Description: Pendant of smooth black stone (haematite?); pierced for suspension; maybe used as an amuletic pendant or as a weight for fishing-net (less likely); polished surfaces.
Curator's comments: Other similar pendants were discovered in Naukratis: Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 11.45987; Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1886.539. According to Petrie, such pendant had some amuletic properties and were worn as forehead pendants, in burial contexts; the examples are however dated to the Prehistoric and modern period (Petrie 1914, 29, pl. XVI no. 130). It is uncertain if Naukratis examples had similar function and context of discovery. Petrie, W.M.F. 1914, Amulets, London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OK.397) (phase 3)
